thread.title: Green says he doesn't hate Mundine, invites him for tea | Other Sports | Sporting News
thread.title_full: Green says he doesn't hate Mundine, invites him for tea | Other Sports | Sporting News

author: Brendan Bradford
title: Green says he doesn't hate Mundine, invites him for tea | Other Sports | Sporting News
text:
Published on Jan. 31, 2017 
Jan. 31, 2017 
From the outside, it looks like one of the most intense rivalries in Australian sport, but Danny Green says he doesn’t hate Anthony Mundine. 
MORE: Mundine to take anthem boycott a step further? | McGregor eyes up Mayweather 
‘The Green Machine’ will square off against Mundine in Adelaide this Friday in a rematch of their 2006 bout in Sydney. 
Green is hell-bent on gaining revenge for that first-up unanimous decision loss, but says he doesn’t know Mundine well enough to hate him. 
Their enmity, he says, only exists between the ropes. 
“I don’t hate him. I do talks and stuff and people say ‘oh, you hate that bloke’ but no, I don’t know the bloke enough to hate him,” Green told Fox Sports . 
“Our rivalry has been great for both of our careers. So I look at him as a positive. 
“We’ve always been linked to each other from a very long time ago. It’s been a long rivalry. 
“I don’t know in the future whether we’ll sit down and have a cup of tea. No worries, I’m cool, I’ll have a cup of tea. No problem. I’ve got no problem with that. It doesn’t bother me. 
“I’ll smash you on the third, then we’ll have a cup of tea.”
